# Introduction

**Legesher.io** is the official website for the Legesher project â€” developer tools that enable coding in your native written language. Our mission is to empower developers worldwide to create without losing the art of innovation, creativity, or collaboration in translation.

## What is Legesher?

Legesher bridges the gap between the language you speak and the code you write. Instead of forcing developers to learn English-based programming syntax, Legesher provides tools to write code in your native language while maintaining full compatibility with existing programming ecosystems.

**Features:**
- ğŸŒ **Multi-language support** - Code in Spanish, Mandarin, Hindi, Arabic, and many more languages
- ğŸ”„ **Seamless translation** - Convert between natural language syntax and traditional programming languages
- ğŸ› ï¸ **IDE integrations** - VS Code extensions and editor support
- ğŸ“š **Comprehensive documentation** - Guides and tutorials in multiple languages
- ğŸ¤ **Community-driven** - Built by developers, for developers worldwide

---

## ğŸš€ Getting Started

### Prerequisites

- Node.js 18+ and npm
- Git

### Installation

**1ï¸âƒ£ Fork the repository**
Visit [legesher/legesher-dot-io](https://github.com/legesher/legesher-dot-io) and click "Fork" in the top right.

**2ï¸âƒ£ Clone your fork**
```bash
git clone git@github.com:your-username/legesher-dot-io.git
cd legesher-dot-io
```

**3ï¸âƒ£ Install dependencies**
```bash
npm install
```

**4ï¸âƒ£ Set up environment variables**
```bash
cp .env.example .env
# Add your API keys to .env (see .env.example for required variables)
```

### Development Commands

| Command                | Action                                              |
| :--------------------- | :-------------------------------------------------- |
| `npm install`          | Installs dependencies                               |
| `npm run dev`          | Starts local dev server at `localhost:4321`         |
| `npm run build`        | Build production site to `./dist/`                  |
| `npm run preview`      | Preview build locally before deploying              |

## ğŸ—ï¸ Project Structure

```text
legesher-dot-io/
â”œâ”€â”€ .github/                    # GitHub configuration files
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ workflows/              # GitHub Actions
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ CONTRIBUTING.md         # Contribution guidelines
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ SECURITY.md             # Security policy
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ all-contributorsrc.old  # Contributors config
â”œâ”€â”€ public/                     # Static assets
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ images/                 # Images and graphics
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ scripts/                # Client-side JavaScript
â”œâ”€â”€ src/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ components/             # Reusable UI components
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ layouts/                # Page layouts
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ pages/                  # Astro pages & API routes
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ api/                # API endpoints (newsletter, etc.)
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ styles/                 # Global styles
â”œâ”€â”€ astro.config.mjs            # Astro configuration
â”œâ”€â”€ tailwind.config.ts          # Tailwind CSS configuration
â”œâ”€â”€ package.json                # Dependencies
â””â”€â”€ README.md                   # You are here!
```

## ğŸ¤ Contributing

We rely on passionate community members (both developers and non-developers) to keep delivering impactful tools worldwide.

Before contributing, please:
1. Read our [Contributing Guidelines](.github/CONTRIBUTING.md)
2. Review our [Code of Conduct](https://docs.legesher.io/the-official-things/code-of-conduct)
3. Check out [open issues](https://github.com/legesher/legesher-dot-io/issues) or create a new one
4. Look for issues labeled [`good first issue`](https://github.com/legesher/legesher-dot-io/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22good+first+issue%22) if you're new!

### Ways to Contribute

- ğŸ’» **Code** - Fix bugs, add features, improve performance
- ğŸ¨ **Design** - UI/UX improvements, graphics, branding
- ğŸ“ **Documentation** - Improve guides, add translations
- ğŸŒ **Translations** - Help translate content into your language
- ğŸ› **Bug Reports** - Report issues you encounter
- ğŸ’¡ **Ideas** - Suggest new features or improvements
